avatar.name: AvatarViewHelper
avatar.documentation: ViewHelper to render the avatar markup (including the `` tag) for a given backend user. If the given backend user hasn't added a custom avatar yet, a default one is used. ``` ```

size.name: size
size.description: width and height of the image

showIcon.name: showIcon
showIcon.description: show the record icon as well

languageColumn.name: LanguageColumnViewHelper
languageColumn.documentation:
ViewHelper to render a language column in a backend table module.

```
  <be:languageColumn languageColumn="{someColumn}" columnNumber="{colPos}" />
```

docTags.@internal: Not part of the TYPO3 API

languageColumn.name: languageColumn
languageColumn.description: Language column object which is context for column

columnNumber.name: columnNumber
columnNumber.description: Number (colPos) of column within LanguageColumn to be returned

link.documentation.name: Link\DocumentationViewHelper
link.documentation.documentation: Use this ViewHelper to provide a link to the official documentation. The ViewHelper will use the permalink identifier to generate a permalink to the documentation which is a redirect to the actual URI. The identifier must be given as a string. Be aware that very specific short links into the documentation may change over time. The link will always lead to the documentation of the corresponding TYPO3 version. This means in a v12 installation, using `foo-bar` as identifier will link to 'foo-bar@12.4', while in v13 the link will be 'foo-bar@13.4'. Example ======= Link to the documentation:: See documentation Output:: See documentation

docTags.@internal: not part of TYPO3 Core API.

additionalAttributes.name: additionalAttributes
additionalAttributes.description: Additional tag attributes. They will be added directly to the resulting HTML tag.

data.name: data
data.description: Additional data-* attributes. They will each be added with a "data-" prefix.

aria.name: aria
aria.description: Additional aria-* attributes. They will each be added with a "aria-" prefix.

identifier.name: identifier
identifier.description: the documentation permalink identifier as displayed in the modal link popup of any rendered documentation manual

link.editRecord.name: Link\EditRecordViewHelper
link.editRecord.documentation: Use this ViewHelper to provide edit links to records. The ViewHelper will pass the uid and table to FormEngine. The uid must be given as a positive integer. For new records, use the :ref:` `. Examples ======== Link to the record-edit action passed to FormEngine:: Output:: Edit record Link to edit page uid=3 and then return back to the BE module "web_MyextensionList":: Link to edit only the fields title and subtitle of page uid=42 and return to foo/bar:: Edit record Output:: Edit record

additionalAttributes.name: additionalAttributes
additionalAttributes.description: Additional tag attributes. They will be added directly to the resulting HTML tag.

data.name: data
data.description: Additional data-* attributes. They will each be added with a "data-" prefix.

aria.name: aria
aria.description: Additional aria-* attributes. They will each be added with a "aria-" prefix.

uid.name: uid
uid.description: uid of record to be edited

fields.name: fields
fields.description: Edit only these fields (comma separated list)

module.name: module
module.description: Set module identifier for context - marking as acitve when editing the record

returnUrl.name: returnUrl
returnUrl.description: return to this URL after closing the edit dialog

link.newRecord.name: Link\NewRecordViewHelper
link.newRecord.documentation: Use this ViewHelper to provide 'create new record' links. The ViewHelper will pass the command to FormEngine. The table argument is mandatory, it decides what record is to be created. The pid argument will put the new record on this page, if ``0`` given it will be placed to the root page. The uid argument accepts only negative values. If this is given, the new record will be placed (by sorting field) behind the record with the uid. It will end up on the same pid as this given record, so the pid must not be given explicitly by pid argument. An exception will be thrown, if both uid and pid are given. An exception will be thrown, if the uid argument is not a negative integer. To edit records, use the :ref:` `. Examples ======== Link to create a new record of a_table after record 17 on the same pid:: Output:: New record Link to create a new record of a_table on root page:: Output:: New record Link to create a new record of a_table on page 17:: Output:: New record Link to create a new record then return back to the BE module "web_MyextensionList":: Output:: New record Link to create a new record of a_table on page 17 with a default value:: Output:: New record

additionalAttributes.name: additionalAttributes
additionalAttributes.description: Additional tag attributes. They will be added directly to the resulting HTML tag.

data.name: data
data.description: Additional data-* attributes. They will each be added with a "data-" prefix.

aria.name: aria
aria.description: Additional aria-* attributes. They will each be added with a "aria-" prefix.

uid.name: uid
uid.description: uid < 0 will insert the record after the given uid

pid.name: pid
pid.description: the page id where the record will be created

module.name: module
module.description: Set module identifier for context - marking as acitve when editing the record

returnUrl.name: returnUrl
returnUrl.description: return to this URL after closing the new record dialog

defaultValues.name: defaultValues
defaultValues.description: default values for fields of the new record

loginLogo.name: LoginLogoViewHelper
loginLogo.documentation:
ViewHelper to display the login logo.

```
  <backend:loginLogo />
```

mfa.ifHasState.name: Mfa\IfHasStateViewHelper
mfa.ifHasState.documentation:
ViewHelper to check if the given provider for the current user has the requested state set.

```
  <be:mfa.ifHasState state="active" provider="{provider}">
      ...
  </be:mfa.ifHasState>
```

then.name: then
then.description: Value to be returned if the condition if met.

else.name: else
else.description: Value to be returned if the condition if not met.

state.name: state
state.description: The state to check for (e.g. active or locked)

moduleLink.name: ModuleLinkViewHelper
moduleLink.documentation:
ViewHelper to create internal links within the backend.

```
 <form action="{be:moduleLink(route:'pages_new', arguments:'{id:pageUid}')}" method="post">
    <!-- form content -->
 </form>
```

arguments.name: arguments
arguments.description: Additional link arguments (e.g. id or returnUrl)

query.name: query
query.description: Additional link arguments as string  (e.g. id or returnUrl)

currentUrlParameterName.name: currentUrlParameterName
currentUrlParameterName.description: Add current URL as given parameter

thumbnail.name: ThumbnailViewHelper
thumbnail.documentation: ViewHelper for the backend which generates an `` tag with the special URI to render thumbnails deferred. ``` ```

additionalAttributes.name: additionalAttributes
additionalAttributes.description: Additional tag attributes. They will be added directly to the resulting HTML tag.

data.name: data
data.description: Additional data-* attributes. They will each be added with a "data-" prefix.

aria.name: aria
aria.description: Additional aria-* attributes. They will each be added with a "aria-" prefix.

src.name: src
src.description: a path to a file, a combined FAL identifier or an uid (int). If $treatIdAsReference is set, the integer is considered the uid of the sys_file_reference record. If you already got a FAL object, consider using the $image parameter instead

treatIdAsReference.name: treatIdAsReference
treatIdAsReference.description: given src argument is a sys_file_reference record

crop.name: crop
crop.description: overrule cropping of image (setting to FALSE disables the cropping set in FileReference)

cropVariant.name: cropVariant
cropVariant.description: select a cropping variant, in case multiple croppings have been specified or stored in FileReference

width.name: width
width.description: width of the image. This can be a numeric value representing the fixed width of the image in pixels. But you can also perform simple calculations by adding "m" or "c" to the value. See imgResource.width for possible options.

height.name: height
height.description: height of the image. This can be a numeric value representing the fixed height of the image in pixels. But you can also perform simple calculations by adding "m" or "c" to the value. See imgResource.width for possible options.

toolbar.attributes.name: Toolbar\AttributesViewHelper
toolbar.attributes.documentation:
ViewHelper to build a "class" attribute string for use in rendered toolbar items.

```
 <be:toolbar.attributes class="{someToolbarItemInterfaceInstance}" />
```

class.name: class
class.description: Class being converted to a string for usage as id attribute

toolbar.ifHasDropdown.name: Toolbar\IfHasDropdownViewHelper
toolbar.ifHasDropdown.documentation:
ViewHelper condition to checks whether a toolbar item provides a dropdown menu.

```
 <be:toolbar.ifHasDropdown class="{toolbarItem}">
     <f:then>...</f:then>
     <f:else>...</f:else>
 </be:toolbar.ifHasDropdown>
```

then.name: then
then.description: Value to be returned if the condition if met.

else.name: else
else.description: Value to be returned if the condition if not met.

class.name: class
class.description: The toolbar item class to be checked for providing a drop down

typoScript.fineDiff.name: TypoScript\FineDiffViewHelper
typoScript.fineDiff.documentation:
ViewHelper to runs two strings through 'FineDiff' on word level.

```
  <backend:typoScript.fineDiff from="{someTextChunkBefore}" to="{someTextChunkAfter}" />
```

docTags.@internal: This experimental ViewHelper is not part of TYPO3 Core API and may change or vanish any time.

uri.editRecord.name: Uri\EditRecordViewHelper
uri.editRecord.documentation:
ViewHelper to provide edit links (only the URI) to records. The ViewHelper will
pass the uid and table to FormEngine.

The uid must be given as a positive integer.
For new records, use `<be:uri.newRecord>`.

```
   <be:uri.editRecord uid="42" table="pages" fields="title,subtitle" returnUrl="foo/bar" />
```

uid.name: uid
uid.description: uid of record to be edited, 0 for creation

fields.name: fields
fields.description: Edit only these fields (comma separated list)

module.name: module
module.description: Set module identifier for context - marking as acitve when editing the record

returnUrl.name: returnUrl
returnUrl.description: return to this URL after closing the edit dialog

uri.newRecord.name: Uri\NewRecordViewHelper
uri.newRecord.documentation:
ViewHelper to provide 'create new record' links.
The ViewHelper will pass the command to FormEngine.

The `pid` argument will put the new record on this page, if ``0`` given it will
be placed to the root page.

The `uid` argument accepts only negative values. If this is given, the new
record will be placed (by sorting field) behind the record with the uid.
It will end up on the same pid as this given record, so the pid must not
be given explicitly by pid argument.

An exception will be thrown, if both uid and pid are given.
An exception will be thrown, if the uid argument is not a negative integer.

```
   <be:uri.newRecord table="a_table" returnUrl="foo/bar" uid="-17"/>
   <be:uri.newRecord table="a_table" returnUrl="foo/bar" pid="17"/>
```

uid.name: uid
uid.description: uid < 0 will insert the record after the given uid

pid.name: pid
pid.description: the page id where the record will be created

module.name: module
module.description: Set module identifier for context - marking as acitve when editing the record

returnUrl.name: returnUrl
returnUrl.description: return to this URL after closing the edit dialog

defaultValues.name: defaultValues
defaultValues.description: default values for fields of the new record
